list_definition.definition: a slight metallic ringing sound (made eg by coins or by small bells)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The dog pricked up its ears at the jingle of its master’s keys.

list_definition.definition: a simple rhyming verse or tune

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: nursery rhymes and other little jingles

list_definition.definition: to (cause to) make a clinking or ringing sound; He jingled the coins in his pocket.

list_ex_of_english: He has also many ad films and jingles to his contribution.
Band members also spent much time performing television and radio jingles.
Music, commercials and jingles were all called up from a series of carts also by the computer system.
He also creates all of the jingles for various segments, which are mostly other songs with alternate lyrics.
They have adopted a lot of the jingles and format of the pirates and evolved them into a new style of their own.
To put it simply, children are subjected to repeated imagery and carefully constructed memorable jingles.
They repeatedly hear catch-phrases and jingles designed to appeal to them.
The show was also characterised by its musical score of campy jingles introducing the regular segments.
